TextView.android:text: How it affects? It's a fungal disease that survives in infected seeds. This disease occurs more near thenear the northern hilly regions. High soil moisture and temperature range of 18-200C favours the disease. It affects the grains and results in degraded quality by producing foul smell and discolouration. How to identify? Also known as covered smut, ball smut, sticking smut, symptoms appear during the heading stage. Disease occurrence can be detected by the foul smell (Grains give off a fishy odour). Slender bluish-green and stay greener longer than healthy heads. During maturity: bunt balls change to a dull gray-brown color. Bunt balls rupture and produce spores during the harvest.
